results.title: Converting enzyme inhibition improves congestion and survival in hypertensive rats with high-output heart failure.
results.text_hl: Heart weight, BP, and CO were not affected by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@. Thus, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ ameliorated @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002311 @@@congestion@@@ and improved survival in SHR with @DISEASE_Fistula @DISEASE_MESH:D005402 @@@fistula@@@ without compromising cardiorenal hemodynamics.

citations.NLM: Nishimura H, Oka T, Ueyama M, Kubota J, Kawamura K. Converting enzyme inhibition improves congestion and survival in hypertensive rats with high-output heart failure. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1994 Jan;23(1):149-54. PMID: 7511728

results.title: Comparison of the effects of omapatrilat and lisinopril on circulating neurohormones and cytokines in patients with chronic heart failure.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ (n = 107) with @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002311 @@@ischemic or dilated cardiomyopathy@@@, New York Heart Association functional class II to III, with left ventricular ejection fraction <40%, and on ACE inhibitor therapy were randomized to either the VPI @CHEMICAL_omapatrilat @CHEMICAL_MESH:C106266 @@@omapatrilat@@@ 40 mg/day or the ACE inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 20 mg/day.

citations.NLM: Sheth T, Parker T, Block A, Hall C, Adam A, Pfeffer MA, Stewart DJ, Qian C, Rouleau JL, IMPRESS Investigators. Comparison of the effects of omapatrilat and lisinopril on circulating neurohormones and cytokines in patients with chronic heart failure. Am J Cardiol. 2002 Sep 1;90(5):496-500. PMID: 12208409
citations.BibTeX: @article{12208409, title={Comparison of the effects of omapatrilat and lisinopril on circulating neurohormones and cytokines in patients with chronic heart failure.}, author={Sheth T and Parker T and Block A and Hall C and Adam A and Pfeffer MA and Stewart DJ and Qian C and Rouleau JL and IMPRESS Investigators}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={90}, number={5}, pages={496-500}}

results.title: Reversible cardiac dysfunction in long-standing hypertension may be global variant of stress cardiomyopathy.
results.text_hl: He responded well to diuretics and gradual uptitration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@.

citations.NLM: Chockalingam A, Kumar SA. Reversible cardiac dysfunction in long-standing hypertension may be global variant of stress cardiomyopathy. BMJ Case Rep. 2018 Jun 29;2018():. PMID: 29960964
